name: vdm-vscode
description: Support for the VDM modelling languages: VDM-SL, VDM++ and VDM-RT

commands.title: Open real-time log in log viewer
Restart Client (of the active text document)

viewsWelcome.contents:
You can also import a VDM example by clicking the button below.
[Import VDM example](command:vdm-vscode.importExample)

explorer/context.when: explorerResourceIsFolder && vdm-submenus-show == true || resourceLangId == vdmsl && vdm-submenus-show == true || resourceLangId == vdmpp && vdm-submenus-show == true || resourceLangId == vdmrt && vdm-submenus-show == true

editor/context.when: resourceLangId == vdmsl && vdm-submenus-show == true || resourceLangId == vdmpp && vdm-submenus-show == true || resourceLangId == vdmrt && vdm-submenus-show == true

vdm-vscode.server.JVMArguments.title: JVM Arguments
vdm-vscode.server.JVMArguments.description: JVM arguments used when launching the server.

vdm-vscode.server.classPathAdditions.markdownDescription: List of folder and/or file paths that should be included in the class path for the language server. [Find folders](command:vdm-vscode.addFoldersToClassPath), [Find files](command:vdm-vscode.addFilesToClassPath), or type in manually.

vdm-vscode.server.libraries.VDM-Librarie.markdownDescription: A list containing library jar paths. Adding a folder path will load all library jars in the folder. If using a relative path it is expected to be defined at the 'folder' settings level as the path is expected to be relative to the corresponding project. [Find folders](command:vdm-vscode.addLibraryJarFolders), [Find files](command:vdm-vscode.addLibraryJars), or type in manually.

vdm-vscode.server.libraries.includeDefau.description: Include the default libraries that are packaged with the extension.

vdm-vscode.server.highPrecision.description: Use high precision variant of VDMJ.

vdm-vscode.server.strict.description: Activate the VDMJ -strict flag that highlights (with warnings) where a specification is taking advantage of lenient parsing rule.

classname.description: Fully qualified name of the main class

jar.description: Path to the jar file containing the plugin

dialects.description: Optional: Dialects that the plugin supports. If not included, it is assumed that the plugin is available for all VDM dialects

vdm-vscode.server.plugins.description: Plugins for the VDMJ language server.

vdm-vscode.javaCodeGen.disableCloning.description: Disable cloning (may lead to code being generated that does not preserve the semantics of the input specification)

vdm-vscode.javaCodeGen.vdmLocationInform.description: Generate VDM location information for code generated constructs

vdm-vscode.javaCodeGen.skipClassesModule.description: Skip classes/modules during the code generation process. Separate by ';' e.g : World;Env

vdm-vscode.translate.latex.modelOnly.description: Only model part will be included in the Latex translation, i.e., everything enclosed within '\begin{vdm_al}' and '\end{vdm_al}'

vdm-vscode.translate.latex.markCoverage.description: Mark coverage in the Latex translation

vdm-vscode.translate.latex.insertCoverag.description: Insert coverage tables in the Latex translation

vdm-vscode.translate.general.storeAllTra.description: Stores each translation in a timestamped folder instead of overwriting the previous content

vdm-vscode.translate.general.allowSingle.description: If enabled, translates only the selected file. If disabled, translate is always applied to the whole project

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.strict.description: Strict handling of certain errors (e.g. print output or not, raise VDMJ warnings as translation errors, etc.).

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.maxErrors.description: Maximum number (default=100) of translation errors to report. This is similar to VDMJ's maxErrors

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.reportVDMW.description: Report VDMJ warnings as part of the plugin output.

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.linientPos.description: Translate VDM source as an Isabelle comment alongside its translation.

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.printVDMCo.description: Prints VDM user comments as Isabelle comments when true, or ignore them when false.

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.printIsaCo.description: Prints Isabelle translation comments to the user (e.g., explanatory comments about translation's implicit VDM checks).

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.runExu.description: Chooses whether to run the Exu VDM analyser prior to translation. Exu will provide information about VDM style and potential translation issues.

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.valueAsAbb.description: Translate VDM values as Isabelle abbreviations when true, and as Isabelle definitions when false.

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.translateT.description: Translate VDM min_T or max_T when translating ordering predicates for type definitions.

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.printVDMSo.description: Translate VDM source as an Isabelle comment immediately before its translation.

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.printLocat.description: Translate VDM source location information as an Isabelle comment alongside its VDM source translation.

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.runIsapog.description: Translate VDM POs as a separate theory file associated with the recently translated VDM model.

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.linientInv.description: Exu invariant type checks allow subtyping instead of explicit invariant/pre calls.

vdm-vscode.translate.isabelle.proofStrat.description: Proof strategy choice for the `isapog` plugin. It determines what kind of proof script the plugin will generate for the translated PO.

vdm-vscode.coverage.UseHeatmapColouring.description: If enabled, the number of hits (larger than zero) corresponds to a brighter green. If disabled, all sections with any number (hits larger than zero) are colored the same green.

vdm-vscode.coverage.OverlayLatestCoverag.description: If enabled, the latest generated coverage is utilised for overlaying. If disabled, it is possible to choose which coverage should be used for overlaying.

vdm-vscode.encoding.showWarning.markdownDescription: If enabled, shows a warning if document encoding is not UTF-8

vdm-vscode.combinatorialTesting.groupSiz.description: Determine the maximum group size for tests in the combinatorial testing view

vdm-vscode.real-timeLogViewer.scaleWithE.description: Enable scaling of the view relative to the current font size of the editor

vdm-vscode.real-timeLogViewer.matchTheme.description: Enable colours of the view to match the current theme of the editor

vdm-vscode.real-timeLogViewer.fontSize.description: Font size to use for the relative scaling of elements in the diagram. Only used if `#vdm-vscode.other.real-timeLogViewer.scaleWithEditorFont#` is disabled

vdm-vscode.trace.server.description: Enables tracing of LSP messages between VS Code and the VDMJ language server. The trace may contain file paths, source code, and other potentially sensitive information from your project

vdm-vscode.server.development.experiment.description: Use experimental server. True if the client should not launch the server, but connect to a server on a socket connection determined by `#vdm-vscode.server.development.experimentalServer#`.

vdm-vscode.server.development.lspPort.title: LSP Port
vdm-vscode.server.development.lspPort.markdownDescription: Port used for LSP. NOTE: Only used when `#vdm-vscode.server.development.experimentalServer#` is active.

vdm-vscode.server.logLevel.markdownDescription: Enables logging of the VDMJ server to a file [in this folder](command:vdm-vscode.openServerLogFolder). This log can be used to diagnose server issues. The log may contain file paths, source code, and other potentially sensitive information from your project.

vdm-vscode.server.stdio.activateStdoutLo.description: Activate logging of stdout/stderr to the terminal window. NOTE: This may cause performance slowdown if specifications have many annotations.

vdm-vscode.server.stdio.stdioLogPath.markdownDescription: File path for the directory that should be used to store stdout/stderr logs. NOTE: If empty, terminal logging is used instead of file logging. The setting is only used when `#vdm-vscode.server.stdio.activateStdoutLogging#` is active.

vdm-vscode.server.verbose.description: Activate the VDMJ -verbose flag that sends detailed information to the VDMJ console.

defaultName.description: Name of the default module or class.

trace.description: Enable logging of the Debug Adapter Protocol.

command.description: Run single execution of command and terminate.

remoteControl.description: Delegate the control of the interpreter, thus the remote controller is in charge of the execution or debug session.

precision.description: Precision level if using high precision (ignored for regular precision).

dynamicTypeChecks.description: Type check values during interpretation of a VDM model.

invariantsChecks.description: Check both state and type invariants.

preConditionChecks.description: Check pre-conditions for all functions and operations during interpretation of a VDM model.

postConditionChecks.description: Check post-conditions for all functions and operations during interpretation of a VDM model.

measureChecks.description: Check recursive functions, for which a function has been defined.

vdmj.annotations.packages.description: The package list for annotation classes to load (default 'com.fujitsu.vdmj.ast.annotations;annotations.ast')

vdmj.mapping.search_path.description: An alternative search path for the ClassMapper (default null)

vdmj.tc.skip_recursive_check.description: Skip the check for mutually-recursive function calls (default false)

vdmj.tc.skip_cyclic_check.description: Skip the check for definition dependency cycles (default false)

vdmj.traces.max_errors.description: The maximum TC errors reported before 'Too many errors' (default 100)

vdmj.traces.max_repeats.description: The maximum number of expansions for '+'' and '*' trace patterns (default 5)

vdmj.traces.save_state.description: Serialize the system state between trace tests (default false)

vdmj.traces.max_arg_length.description: The size below which trace function args are expanded (default 50)

vdmj.scheduler.fcfs_timeslice.description: The default timeslice (statements executed) for the FCFS policy (default 10)

vdmj.scheduler.jitter.description: The timeslice variation (+/- jitter ticks, default 0)

vdmj.rt.duration_default.description: The default duration for RT statements (default 2)

vdmj.rt.log_instvarchanges.description: Enable InstVarChange RT log entries (default false)

vdmj.rt.max_periodic_overlaps.description: Maximum period thread overlaps allowed per object (default 20 - zero mean off)

vdmj.rt.diags_guards.description: Enable extra diagnostics for guards etc. (default false)

vdmj.rt.diags_timestep.description: Enable extra RT log diagnostics for timesteps (default false)

vdmj.in.powerset_limit.description: The set size limit for power set expressions (default 30)

configurationSnippets.label: VDM: Console
configurationSnippets.description: Initialise interpreter for a VDM project.

configurationSnippets.label: VDM: Entry Point (VDM-SL)
configurationSnippets.description: Launch a VDM project from the specified entry point.

configurationSnippets.label: VDM: Entry Point (VDM++/-RT)
configurationSnippets.description: Launch a VDM project from the specified entry point.

configurationSnippets.label: VDM: Remote Control (VDM-SL/++/-RT)
configurationSnippets.description: Launch VDM project using remote control.

configurationSnippets.label: VDM: Test Runner
configurationSnippets.description: Run VDM tests using the VDMUnit frameworks TestRunner class.

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run check:version && npm run compile
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run check:version && npm run compile
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run check:version && npm run package
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
